nodes.body:
The marker ན་ has locative (without movement) case functions:

  • ལག་ན་ “In the hand”
  • ས་མཚམས་ན་ “At the border”

And finally, apart from its meaning of “if”[1] (as in Spoken Tibetan), it may also mean “when”:

  • མེ་ཡོག་ན་དུ་བ་འབྱུང་། “If there’s fire, there’s smoke.”
  • ས་བོན་བཏབ་ན་འབྲས་བུ་སྐྱེ། “If you plant a seed, a fruit will grow.”
  • ནད་མེད་ན་སྨན་པ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་བསྟེན། “If there’s no illness, why consult a doctor?”
  • རྒྱ་མཚོ་མཐོང་བ་ན་ཁྲོན་པའི་སྦལ་པ་བརྒྱལ་ནས་མགོ་གས་ཏེ་ཤི་སྐད། “It is said that, when it saw the ocean, the frog in the well fainted, its head burst and it died.”

 

[1] The marker ན་ is almost always associated with the past form of the verb (when there is such a form) or the auxiliary. There are, however, some exceptions to this rule, especially in the case of negation.
